"hs_additional_emails" is a contact property that stores those
Sorry I’ve been super slammed today
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/blog-post>
So I’ve done this a few times before.. What I do is setup a blog in my developer account with one post
It has like 12 different paragraphs, a title, etc, all the things

I create a get blog post api call to that post, and then I create a bunch of new posts in the target portal/blog

And in doing so, what I do is scramble the words. Basically splitting the content into an array on spaces, reorganizing the array randomly, then join them back together with spaces… and then create the post

good luck — I vote doing it in production LOL but I do everything perfect the first time so that’s why I say DO IT IN PRODUCTION

_I’m being very sarcastic here_

I think I found it! When you make a request to `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/>` you can add a parameter `associations=contact` (comma separated list). Which returns an array of objects listing the default association (in this case contact to object) and the association label, with the Contact ID. Running tests now - happy to elaborate.

Ok, I didn’t understand, on further investigation I found the `List associations of an object by type` that you mention <@U042P4WQRGS> does what it says… It returns and array of objects, with each Object lists with the basic relationship (e.g. Contact to Company) with the Object ID AND the Association Label (e.g. Contact is the “Accountant” for the Company) with the Object ID. Solved.
livin on the edge!

Any idea?
